column2: a simple, low cost, robotics gripper

column7: Use screws that come with it for pulley mounting

column1: I used MJF for all the plastic parts from JLCPCB, but everything can be easily FDM printed.

column6: I got from SendCutSend. If you want high force grasps, switch to stainless. If you want to lasercut/waterjet and countersink yourself, use the DXF. If you are CNCing use the STEP.
